page.title: 05BURTON JOYCE-EMPLOYMENT
page.content: 149 children were interviewed in the junior classes about their parents' employment. Many more fathers worked full time than mothers (130 to 56) while 40 other mothers worked part time. There were 3 fathers who didn't work compared with 43 mothers. Very few of the men actually worked in Burton Joyce,most travelling to Nottingham or elsewhere.Similarly, most women travelled to their work though some were employed full time in the village. Even part-timers often needed to travel to their jobs. A mother who does work in the village Mrs.Fletcher,is one of 8 home helps operating in both private houses & at Westwolds Blind Home.Her jobs include washing,ironing,cleaning,vacuuming, shopping,collecting pensions and prescriptions,cooking and generally giving attention to the elderly.
